text: Luísa Dias Diogo (born 11 April 1958) is a Mozambican politician. He was Prime Minister of Mozambique from February 2004 to January 2010. She replaced Pascoal Mocumbi.Mateus Chale, "Guebuza names cabinet to fight poverty", Reuters (IOL), 4 February 2005. She was the first female Prime Minister of Mozambique. Diogo represents the party FRELIMO.Skard, Torild (2014), "Luisa Diogo", in Women of Power - half a century of female presidents and prime ministers worldwide, Bristol: Policy Press, . ==References== Category:1958 births Category:Living people Category:Prime Ministers of Mozambique
title: Luísa Diogo
